searchDocs.title: exposeInternal​
searchDocs.content: </> loader.exposeInternal() → internal-- the internal helper and configuration object Exposes the internal utility class, granting access to core loader functions and configuration.

searchDocs.title: load_children​
searchDocs.content: </> loader:load_children( container: Instance ,-- the container whose children modules to load predicate: predicate<Instance >?-- optional filter to select which modules to load ) → any-- a promise resolving when all modules and their starts complete Loads child modules of a given container, applying an optional filter predicate.

searchDocs.title: load_descendants​
searchDocs.content: </> loader:load_descendants( container: Instance ,-- the container whose descendant modules to load predicate: predicate<Instance >?-- optional filter to select which modules to load ) → any-- a promise resolving when all modules and their starts complete Loads descendant modules of a given container, applying an optional filter predicate.

searchDocs.title: print​
searchDocs.content: </> internal.print( msg: string-- the message to print ) → () Prints a formatted message to the output console if logging is enabled.

searchDocs.title: warn​
searchDocs.content: </> internal.warn( msg: string-- the warning message to display ) → () Sends a formatted warning message to the output console if logging is enabled.

searchDocs.title: error​
searchDocs.content: </> internal.error( msg: string-- the error message to raise ) → () Raises a formatted error message and halts execution if logging is enabled.

searchDocs.title: getInstanceName​
searchDocs.content: </> internal.getInstanceName( instance: Instance -- the instance whose name or full name will be returned ) → string-- the formatted name (either Name or FullName depending on config) Returns a formatted name for the given instance, used primarily for logging and debugging.

searchDocs.title: change_env_const​
searchDocs.content: </> internal.change_env_const( envConstant: envConstants,-- one of "LOGGING_ENABLED", "LOGGING_PREFIX", or "USE_FULL_NAME" newValue: any-- the new value to assign to the selected constant ) → () Dynamically updates one of the loader’s runtime configuration constants. This allows toggling logging, changing the log prefix, or switching between instance names and full names in debug output.

searchDocs.title: waitFor​
searchDocs.content: </> internal.waitFor( name: string-- the name of the module to wait for ) → any-- a resolving or rejecting promise based on module availability Waits for the specified module to finish its start lifecycle before continuing. Returns a promise that resolves when the target module has completed starting, allowing dependent modules to sequence their initialization using methods like :andThen().

searchDocs.title: safeRequire​
searchDocs.content: </> internal.safeRequire( module: ModuleScript -- the module to require and initialize ) → any-- a promise resolving to the required module Safely requires a module and executes its lifecycle methods (init and start). If the module exports init, it is invoked immediately. If it exports start, a start promise is created and tracked. Also injects waitFor into the module so it can depend on others.

searchDocs.title: load_modules​
searchDocs.content: </> internal.load_modules( container: Instance ,-- the Roblox instance containing modules to load useDescendants: boolean,-- whether to include all descendants (true) or only direct children (false) predicate: predicate<Instance >?-- optional filter function to select modules ) → any-- a promise resolving to true if all modules loaded successfully, false otherwise Loads and initializes modules from a specified container, optionally including descendants, and filters them using an optional predicate. Each module is safely required, its lifecycle methods invoked, and start promises tracked. Returns a promise that resolves after all modules and their start routines complete.
